name: Scarf One
description:
Thoroughly handmade scarf.  I start with plain white silk/rayon velvet. I design and make the screens to print the dyes and apply the burnout chemical onto the velvet fabric.

	The process takes days but the result is a one of a kind scarf.

	Using multiple dye methods I screenprint and immersion dye the fabrics. I then do the sewing to assemble the scarf.  The decorative fringe is a one of a kind loose serged creation, individual to this  scarf.

	!00% silk organza and Silk/Rayon velvet.

name: Statue Birdy Scarf Silk Rayon Devore'
description:
One of a kind, hand made, I start with solid white silk rayon velvet and do the chemical burnout to create the cut velvet designs (stripes, lace curtain), I then use multiple dye methods to screen print and immersion dye to achieve splendid colors and unique design.

	I’ve sewn horizontal pleats in the burnout sections for textural detail

	I hand make one thing at a time.

	This scarf is 6 feet in length and 9.5 inches wide.
The reverse side is a rich deep turquoise blue with  flame red irregular repeating horizontal stripe.

	Ultimate luxury, nothing else compares.

name: Orange Solar Ruffle Scarf, Organza Silk
description: About 6” X 58” this scarf is a ruffly boa of 100% Silk organza. Uniquely Shibori immersion dyed, the color is variegated and intentionally unevenly dyed. I make one thing at a time with attention to detail and good design. My fine art education and practice are about the mastery of dyeing processes and techniques. All fabrics are 100% dyed and printed by me and I use the best, always.

name: big scarf
description:
UnEvEn EdGeS, ragged thready ends, strips of recycled polyester, upcycled leisure suit stitched and permanently dyed, POLYESTER.

NOTHING else is like this, uniquie scarfie

6 feet by 20 inches

name: scarf
description: Uneven, ragged edges, hanging threads, deconstructed design.  Upcycled leisure suit polyester permanently dyed and hot.
